reviews.text: I agree with all the reivews here. Staying at Shiraume is the most memorable experience in my Japan trip. Dinner and breakfast are excellent. Ms. Tomoka (the owner) is absolutely wonderful. It is worth every penny!! I am glad I decided to stay here.
reviews.title: Exceed my high expectaion
Simply excellent

We enjoyed our stay.

reviews.title: Absolutlely wonderful!!!

reviews.text: - Unbeatable location in the most exquisite area of Kioto, stone lane with a little river.
reviews.title: Charming Ryokan offers an unforgettable experience

reviews.text: I stayed here one night and it was the highlight of our trip to Kyoto and Tokyo. The place is spotless and well appointed - traditional with modern conveniences. I think the pictures here don't quite do it justice. Everything is artfully arranged and pleasing to the eye. Our room had a wonderful view of the canal and the most picturesque street in Kyoto.
reviews.title: Pricey but worth it. Beautiful place, delicious food and amazing service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our kaiseki meal was delicious and memorable. I loved that the owner served many of the courses and gave interesting explanations/background about the dishes. We took pictures of every course and my mother even brought home the tiny baskets made of seaweed! Our Japanese breakfast was also scrumptious!
reviews.title: Worth every penny.

reviews.text: The futons are comfortable and bath super luxurious. My only little complaint is I should have requested a regular sized futon for my toddler. The child-sized futon is super cute, but he kept rolling off of it throughout the night and letting me know about it. Otherwise, a perfect stay!
reviews.title: The Traditional Japanese Equivalent of a 6 Star Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing I can add that already hasnt been said below. Gorgeous little traditional ryokan nestled in a tiny neighborhood seemingly frozen in time in Kyoto....we got the room which faces the river (highly recommended) and I spent time just laying out near the balcony listening to the water trickle past and the sounds of the city. Also splurged for the dinner and breakfast (warning, its a TON of food so come hungry) and both were fantastic and an experience in themselves. Tomoko and her staff are exceptional and the place is everything you would expect and more. It is pricey, but I believe worth every penny. Cant recommend highly enough.
reviews.title: A Slice of Tradition Wrapped with First Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Shiraume for one night on our recent trip around Japan. I have been thinking of how to sum up our experience in just a few words. The best I can think of is "This is the traditional Japanese equivalent of a Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental but even better!"
reviews.title: What is there not to like?

reviews.text: We were a group of 10, so we booked 3 rooms out of the 7 available. Service was impeccable, location is great (very near Nishiki market area and right in the heart of Gion), and the facilities so comfortable and complete. The cedar bath stubs and jacuzzi is a welcome treat after a day's walking. The futon beds were so comfortable everyone slept so well that night! Tomoko-san and her team really go out of their way to make the guests comfortable. I'd recommend this to everyone visiting Ryokan for the "true" old Kyoto experience. If budget is an issue, consider staying just for one night before moving to another hotel - really worth it!
reviews.title: warm, professional service. truly a gem of a ryokan!

reviews.text: We stayed in this traditional Ryokan for 1 night in the Umeichirin room on the 2nd floor with a good view of the canal and sweeping willows just in front. From the time we stepped in to the time we left we were well taken care of by Mrs.Tomoko Okuda and her staff. The dinner served in our room after we had our bath in the jacuzzi downstairs were thoughtfully made with food reflecting the season of the year. You can definitely sense that Shiraume put forward its best in quality, service and care for their guest
reviews.title: Traditional Ryokan definitely a rare hidden gem!

reviews.text: We stayed in Shiraume ryokan for 2 night with our 9 year old child.
reviews.title: superb ryokan with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't be more happy: the quality of "everything" was just excellent, the room was really charming and any detail was tought according to the Japanese culture.
reviews.title: Best ryokan experience ever!

reviews.text: We booked a dinner which was served to us in our room: every dish was a masterpiece, the decoration was marvelous and the food was very tasty and delicate at the same time.
reviews.title: AMAZING RYOKAN EXPERIENCE IN KYOTO TOP LOCATION!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every review of Shiraume is right - this is the most beautiful and perfect little ryokan in a lovely historic street. From the warm welcome when we arrived we felt like a king and queen. The food was exquisite, the cedar bath so relaxing, and the service so gentle and warm that we didn't want to leave. The building is utterly perfect with the most beautiful room designs. Shiraume is classy, stylish and charming all at once. We will always carry fond memories of our stay, and plan to visit again.
reviews.title: So beautiful and perfect

reviews.text: Shiraume is the perfect place to enjoy the quiet and graceful life of Kyoto. the location is the best in gion... on the small river, overlooking the most famous cherry tree in Kyoto. The cobblestone streets are clean and you'll see maiko girls walking to work. The immaculate small ryokan is run by Tomoko-san, whose family has owned it for many generations. you'll dine on fantastic kaiseki ryori food in your room or the small dining room, perfectly served by a gracious geisha.
reviews.title: Our home in Kyoto

reviews.text: We have stayed several times at the Shiraume and are counting the days until we can return again to be greeted by our friend Tomoko-san.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Ryokan Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the recent, extensive review here of Ryokan Shiraume, I will reconfirm that Shiraume is a great choice in Kyoto. Coming from a week in Tokyo, Kyoto and Shiraume felt like the perfect retreat. Tomoko is a wonderful host and our group of 5 (3 rooms) all felt that this was an experience that should not be missed. All of the rooms were nice, but I would recommend one of the ground floor rooms facing the canal.
reviews.title: Charming and exquisite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know that it took me a bit of time to track down the contact information for the hotel. We ended up reserving by emailing the Tomoko directly at tomoko-shiraume@kuf.biglobe.ne.jp Tomoko speaks perfect English and there were no problems arranging or reservations or after arrival.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience
